description.value:
Dark elven culture is based on intrigue, complex plots, assassinations, and exploitation. Known only as slavers to many other cultures, some dark elves shun the cruel nature of their society, seeking to escape to friendlier lands. The typical dark elf has black skin that resembles polished obsidian and stark white or pale yellow hair.

Darkvision. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.races.NZUvYIecaGI54uAw]{Darkvision} Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

Elven Magic. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.races.pxP98VxEhuRTD4bG]{Elven Magic} You know the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.CAxSzHWizrafT033]{Dancing Lights} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.nqBDWkVOfcGZt4YU]{Faerie Fire} spell once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} spell once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and Undercommon.

Foundry Note

You can drag your choices from the above onto your character sheet and it will automatically update.
